Enter percentage to scale keys. Default = 100. Smaller number shrink keys. Larger numbers expand them.
What labels do you want to see on the keys?
What colors do you want to see?
What sounds do you want to hear?
Do you want to play looking at a landscape (wide) display?
What note arrangement on the keys do you want to use?
The octave of the highest note to include.
The lowest playable note to include.
The highest playable note to include.
The octave of the lowest playable note to include.
IsoKeys is an isomorphic musical keyboard. All intervals, chords, and scales have identical patterns, regardless of the key in which one plays.

For more information about this project, please visit http://isokeys.sourceforge.net. Support requests may be made through this site, and source code is also available there under the terms of GNU Public License (version 3).
Distributed by Ineptisoft, a division of Ineptico, a figment of my imagination.

Sounds from the acoustic grand piano soundfont (Yamaha Disklavier Pro), release 2008-09-10 116 samples, 44100Hz, 16bit, by Roberto Gordo Saez, were adapted for use in IsoKeys. Specifically, we translated one velocity layer from the soundfont into Ogg Vorbis format, with an enormous loss of fidelity. Please do not take the IsoKeys piano sound as representative of the quality of this excellent soundfont. It just helped to start from a high-quality source.
The acoustic grand piano soundfont is free. It is built from the Zenph Studios Yamaha Disklavier Pro Piano Multisamples for OLPC.
The soundfont itself and all modifications made to the original samples by Roberto Gordo Saez, published under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license.
Copyright 2008, Roberto Gordo Saez roberto.gordo@gmail.com Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/
Zenph Studios Yamaha Disklavier Pro Piano Multisamples for OLPC:
A collection of Grand Piano samples played by a Yamaha Disklavier Pro. Performed by computer and specifically recorded for OLPC by Dr. Mikhail Krishtal, Director of Music Research and Production, and his team at Zenph Studios. They are included in the OLPC sound sample library.
How is it being done: "The Disklavier Pro has an internal electronically-controlled mechanism that allows it to play sounds with very precise specifications. It has its own file format known as XP MIDI, an extension of standard midi. I Mikhail Krishtal prepare the files for it to play -- in this case, representing notes of different registers, durations, and dynamic levels."
http://csounds.com/olpc/pianoSamplesMikhail/pianoMikhail.html Produced by Zenph Studios in Chapel Hill, North Carolina. The main studio location is in Raleigh, North Carolina.
http://zenph.com/ Samples from the OLPC sound sample library:
This huge collection of new and original samples have been donated to Dr. Richard Boulanger @ cSounds.com specifically to support the OLPC developers, students, XO users, and computer and electronic musicians everywhere. They are FREE and are offered under a CC-BY license.
http://wiki.laptop.org/go/Sound_samples http://csounds.com/boulanger
